description: Concatenations C1 and C2 are both prime (see the comment lines).
comments: C1 = 'prevprime(n) followed by nextprime(n)'C2 = 'nextprime(n) followed by prevprime(n)'
example: n=17 -> next prime is 19, previous prime is 13, thus '1319' and '1913' are both primes.
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Oct 15 1998.
